You can create an ThreeBlackCrows Candlestick Pattern indicator that requires manual update. The following reference table describes the ThreeBlackCrows constructor.

            ThreeBlackCrows QuantConnect.Indicators.ThreeBlackCrows (
     string  name,
   )

Initializes a new instance of the ThreeBlackCrows class using the specified name.

Parameters

Return

ThreeBlackCrows - The new ThreeBlackCrows indicator object.

Definition at line 52 of file CandlestickPatterns/ThreeBlackCrows.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

using QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns;

private ThreeBlackCrows _threeblackcrows;

// In Initialize()
_threeblackcrows = new ThreeBlackCrows(name);
_threeblackcrows.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _threeblackcrows, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_threeblackcrows.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _threeblackcrows.Current.Value;
}
from QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns import ThreeBlackCrows
    
# In Initialize()
self.threeblackcrows = ThreeBlackCrows(name)
self.threeblackcrows.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.threeblackcrows, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.threeblackcrows.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.threeblackcrows.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with a TradeBar. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

using QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns;
    
private ThreeBlackCrows _threeblackcrows;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_threeblackcrows = new ThreeBlackCrows();
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.Bars.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _threeblackcrows.Update(data.Bars[symbol]);
}
if (_threeblackcrows.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _threeblackcrows.Current.Value;
}
from QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns import ThreeBlackCrows
    
# In Initialize()
self.threeblackcrows = ThreeBlackCrows()
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.Bars.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.threeblackcrows.Update(data.Bars[self.symbol])
if self.threeblackcrows.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.threeblackcrows.Current.Value
